item.description:
Not-Me.org is a non-profit that provides instruction, conditioning and training to at-risk populations, to be more assertive and for physical self-defense. The training, equipment and premises is also provided by Not Me! and its volunteers.

 

Right now, every Wednesday evening, they provide free walk-in training to beginners. These sessions are fun and help you get into shape, but at the same time, also teach you the basics of self-defense.

 

What can you expect:

• 5-10 minute warm-up, followed by 35-40 minutes of self-defense basics.

• Get back into shape, have fun, and learn something useful!

• With some regular attendance you will be more confident in your ability to disrupt a would-be attacker.

 

In return, if you enjoy the training, feel free to drop a $5 bill at the front desk as you leave. Your donations help Not-Me! provide additional training to other women/girls.

Website: http://www.not-me.org/

 

 

Check the reviews of one of our past events: http://www.bostonvolunteer.org/events/17418900/

 

***There will be members from 3 other groups, so RSVPs have to be restricted to 5 to help everyone get individual attention. ***
item.how_to_find_us: Walk right in - there is adequate parking right in front of the building.
item.name: Free assertiveness and self-defense training by Not-Me.org
